citations.narrative:
* There was no record of inventory observed on four unweaned puppies born at the facility. The licensee stated that they
had not had time to complete the cage card. Complete and accurate records are needed to ensure each animal's identity
can be known with certainty and to facilitate the ability to trace all puppies. The licensee shall make, keep, and maintain
records or forms which fully and correctly disclose the following information concerning each dog or cat purchased or
otherwise acquired, owned, held, or otherwise in his or her possession or under his or her control, or which is transported,
euthanized, sold, or otherwise disposed of by that dealer or exhibitor. The records shall include any offspring born of any
animal while in his or her possession or under his or her control. Correct by 6/13/24.

* Official ID was missing for five dogs that were recorded on the USDA form 7005.
Records provide a source of information that can be used to identify every animal. Complete and accurate records are
needed to ensure each animal's identity can be known with certainty and to facilitate the ability to trace all animals. The
licensee shall make, keep, and maintain records or forms which fully and correctly disclose the following information
concerning animals other than dogs and cats, purchased or otherwise acquired, owned, held, leased, or otherwise in his
or her possession or under his or her control, or which is transported, sold, euthanized, or otherwise disposed of by the
dealer.
Correct by 6/30/24.

* Rusted, jagged metal with a sharp edge was observed along the bottom of the exterior metal wall. Four dogs are in
contact with the affected surfaces. Rust can erode or deteriorate metal surfaces to the point that the metal surfaces can
no longer be readily cleaned and sanitized. Rust can affect the structural integrity of metal surfaces. The licensee must
ensure all surfaces must be constructed in a manner and made of materials that allow them to be readily cleaned and
sanitized or removed or replaced when worn or soiled. Correct by 6/30/24.

* The last recorded scheduled visit by the attending veterinarian was on 5/23/23. Regularly scheduled visits are important
to determine if all aspects of animal care (nutrition, health, environment, water, and air quality, etc.) are being provided to
the dogs. The licensee must have regularly scheduled visits, not less than once every 12 months, by the attending
veterinarian to the facility where animals are kept, to assess and ensure the adequacy of veterinary care and other
aspects of animal care and use. Correct by 6/30/24.

* Documentation of recorded physical examination for five adult dogs was on 5/23/23. Physical examination of every dog
located at the facility is necessary to evaluate each dog for its overall internal and external physical body condition. The
licensee must have a complete physical examination from head to tail of each dog by the attending veterinarian not less
than once every 12 months. Correct by 6/30/24

* The USDA Vet Care form 7002 A was incomplete. Under the parasite control program sampling and /or treatment plans
for Ectoparasites, Blood and Intestinal Parasites the following treatment plans had been recorded. Under the Ectoparasite
section it stated, “under observation treat as needed”. Under the Blood Parasite section it stated, “under heartworm
treatment at all times”. Under the Intestinal Parasite section, it stated, “observe and treat if diagnostic tests indicate as
need”. Parasites are organisms that depend on a host to survive and spread. Parasites feed, grow, multiply or carry to in
a way that can harm the host. Parasites are immune from diseases and the diseases effect on the host. When the
program of veterinary care is missing information on how the licensee provides for the health of the dogs at the facility, it
is not considered to be adequate veterinary care. Listing the treatment plan that will be provided is important for the
control of different parasites and is a veterinary care requirement. The licensee must record the treatment plan that will be
provided. This plan must have veterinarian approval. Correct by 6/30/24.

The USDA form 7002 A was incomplete. Under the preventive care and treatment care to be maintained for four dogs,
nothing was listed. Care and treatment of the hair coat, nails, eyes, ears, skin, and teeth are necessary for the overall
health of the dog. When the program of vet care is missing information on how the licensee provides for the health and
well-being of all dogs on the premise it is not considered to be adequate veterinary care. It also must include when the
veterinarian will be consulted. The applicant must outline the preventative care and treatment plans to ensure healthy and
unmatted hair coats, properly trimmed nails, and clean and healthy eyes, ears, skin, and teeth. Correct by 6/30/24.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with ______.
n

Records: Dealers and exhibitors.

Correct by 6/30/24. 
3.1(c)(1) 
   
Housing facilities, general.

3.13(a)(4)
